title: Rockwell Just Built a Factory of the Future
body:
Rockwell Automation just announced a brand new factory in New Berlin, Wisconsin.

They call it the "factory of the future." It will build the controllers and drives that run every major assembly line in America.

The company that automates the factories is now automating its own. Ticker ROK. They also just bought their Mequon facility outright.
cta: Next time we're looking at the robots taking over Amazon warehouses. This is Becknology where markets meet machines.
broll: Rockwell Automation factory, PLC assembly line

title: This $184 Billion Industry Nobody Talks About
body:
Industrial automation is a $184 billion market right now. By 2032 it hits $326 billion.

Every car, every chip, every can of Coke -- made by machines that somebody had to program. That somebody is getting replaced by AI.

Rockwell, ABB, Emerson -- these companies are racing to put AI inside every factory on Earth.
cta: Follow along, we're breaking down the machines nobody sees. This is Becknology where markets meet machines.

title: The Wire That Holds the Internet Together
body:
One single fiber optic cable carries 800 terabits per second. Enough to stream every Netflix show at the same time.

Hair-thin glass threads. Data at the speed of light. And one company makes more of it than anyone.

Corning. Same people who make your phone screen. Ticker GLW. Every AI data center being built right now needs their cable.
cta: Next up -- the machine that makes 25,000 cookies a minute. This is Becknology where markets meet machines.
broll: Fiber optic manufacturing, data center cable runs

title: AI is Eating the Factory Floor
body:
A robot arm used to need an engineer to program every single movement. Now it watches a human do it once and copies it.

Fanuc just shipped robots that learn from demonstration. No code required. One operator replaces a whole programming team.

This is why manufacturing jobs aren't coming back the way politicians promise. The machines are learning.
cta: Stick around, next time we're looking at the sensor that sees defects humans can't. This is Becknology where markets meet machines.
broll: Fanuc robot arms, teach pendant demo

title: The Sensor That Sees What You Can't
body:
This sensor checks 10,000 parts per minute. It catches defects smaller than a human hair.

Machine vision. A camera, a laser, and AI -- mounted above a conveyor belt. If the part is 0.01mm off, it gets rejected before it ever leaves the factory.

SICK AG makes sensors like this for every major automaker on Earth. Quality control used to take humans. Now it takes milliseconds.
cta: Next time -- the company that puts a chip in every car. This is Becknology where markets meet machines.
broll: SICK vision sensor, quality inspection line

title: 750,000 Robots and Counting
body:
Amazon has 750,000 robots in its warehouses. That number went up 50% in one year.

They pick, sort, and move packages faster than any human crew. The newest ones see in 3D and navigate around people.

Amazon doesn't talk about this. They'd rather you think humans pack your boxes. But the robots are winning.
cta: Follow along, next time we're looking at the steel nobody thinks about. This is Becknology where markets meet machines.
broll: Amazon warehouse robots, Proteus robot footage

title: Every EV Needs This One Company
body:
Every electric vehicle has 3,000+ electrical connections. Every single one needs a connector.

Not the battery. Not the motor. The tiny metal pieces that make electricity flow from point A to point B. One bad connector and the car doesn't start.

Amphenol makes more connectors than anyone. Ticker APH. Up 40% this year. Nobody talks about them.
cta: Stick around, next time we're looking at what actually makes a semiconductor. This is Becknology where markets meet machines.
broll: EV wiring harness, Amphenol connector close-up

title: The Machine That Makes Machines
body:
A 5-axis CNC machine can cut a jet engine turbine blade from a solid block of metal. One piece. No welds.

It moves on 5 axes simultaneously. Accuracy to 0.001mm. A human machinist would need a week. This takes 4 hours.

DMG Mori makes the machines that make the machines. When you hear "advanced manufacturing" -- this is what they mean.
cta: Next up -- the company hiding inside every vending machine. This is Becknology where markets meet machines.

title: Hidden Inside Every Vending Machine
body:
Every time you put a dollar in a vending machine, a company you've never heard of validates it.

Crane NXT makes the technology that tells real money from fake money. Vending machines, ATMs, self-checkout -- if a machine accepts cash, Crane is probably inside it.

Ticker CR. $7 billion market cap. Completely invisible to most investors.
cta: Follow along, next time we're looking at predictive maintenance -- knowing a machine will break before it does. This is Becknology where markets meet machines.

title: This Machine Knows It's About to Break
body:
A vibration sensor on a motor detects a bearing going bad 6 weeks before it fails.

No human noticed anything. The machine sounds fine. Looks fine. But the data says otherwise.

Predictive maintenance saves factories millions. Rockwell, Honeywell, Siemens -- they're all racing to sell you sensors that predict the future. This is the real AI revolution in manufacturing.
cta: This is Becknology where markets meet machines. Follow for more.
broll: Vibration sensor on motor, predictive maintenance dashboard
